what: calculates parameter-optimized fit (including LL) using a dirichlet multinomial model given a matrix of data (k), a model matrix with the features (mm), and a concentration parameter. — dirmnom_fit

text: k matrix data fit dirichlet multinomial model. mm model matrix features. conc concentration parameter accounts overdispersion. estimate value use estimate_overdispersion() function.

title: calculates parameter-optimized fit (including LL) using a dirichlet multinomial model given a matrix of data (k), a model matrix with the features (mm), and a concentration parameter. — dirmnom_fit
text: list beta = matrix best set parameters found; ll = log-likelihood.

what: Estimates overdispersion in multinomial models — estimate_overdispersion
title: Estimates overdispersion in multinomial models — estimate_overdispersion
text: adaptation code found spread package mclogit. methods estimating overdispersion described Afroz 2018. Summarized page 54 55.

title: Estimates overdispersion in multinomial models — estimate_overdispersion
code: estimate_overdispersion(   y,   fitted_values,   coefs,   method = "Afroz",   number_samples = NULL,   weight = NULL )

title: Estimates overdispersion in multinomial models — estimate_overdispersion
text: y vector multinomial observations. fitted_values fitted mean values. coefs Coefficients number coefficients. method method estimating overdispersion. One "Afroz", "Pearson", "Fletcher", "Deviance". "Afroz" recommended. number_samples number samples fitted. Usually number rows matrix fitted (y). necessary providing flattened y. weight TODO

title: Estimates overdispersion in multinomial models — estimate_overdispersion

what:
calculates a parameter-non-optimized log-likelihood using a dirichlet multinomial model given a matrix of data (k), a model matrix with the features (mm), and a concentration parameter.
This is useful for data sets that fail to converge the optimization process. e.g. those with not so many samples. — rough_dirmnom_ll
